1.text: Now concerning spiritual things, brothers, I don’t want you to be ignorant.

2.text: You know that when you were heathen, you were led away to those mute idols, however you might be led.

3.text: Therefore I make known to you that no man speaking by God’s Spirit says, “Jesus is accursed.” No one can say, “Jesus is Lord,” but by the Holy Spirit.

4.text: Now there are various kinds of gifts, but the same Spirit.

5.text: There are various kinds of service, and the same Lord.

6.text: There are various kinds of workings, but the same God, who works all things in all.

7.text: But to each one is given the manifestation of the Spirit for the profit of all.

8.text: For to one is given through the Spirit the word of wisdom, and to another the word of knowledge, according to the same Spirit;

9.text: to another faith, by the same Spirit; and to another gifts of healings, by the same Spirit;

10.text: and to another workings of miracles; and to another prophecy; and to another discerning of spirits; to another different kinds of languages; and to another the interpretation of languages.

11.text: But the one and the same Spirit works all of these, distributing to each one separately as he desires.

12.text: For as the body is one, and has many members, and all the members of the body, being many, are one body; so also is Christ.

13.text: For in one Spirit we were all baptized into one body, whether Jews or Greeks, whether bond or free; and were all given to drink into one Spirit.

14.text: For the body is not one member, but many.

15.text: If the foot would say, “Because I’m not the hand, I’m not part of the body,” it is not therefore not part of the body.

16.text: If the ear would say, “Because I’m not the eye, I’m not part of the body,” it’s not therefore not part of the body.

17.text: If the whole body were an eye, where would the hearing be? If the whole were hearing, where would the smelling be?

18.text: But now God has set the members, each one of them, in the body, just as he desired.

19.text: If they were all one member, where would the body be?

20.text: But now they are many members, but one body.

21.text: The eye can’t tell the hand, “I have no need for you,” or again the head to the feet, “I have no need for you.”

22.text: No, much rather, those members of the body which seem to be weaker are necessary.

23.text: Those parts of the body which we think to be less honorable, on those we bestow more abundant honor; and our unpresentable parts have more abundant propriety;

24.text: whereas our presentable parts have no such need. But God composed the body together, giving more abundant honor to the inferior part,

25.text: that there should be no division in the body, but that the members should have the same care for one another.

26.text: When one member suffers, all the members suffer with it. Or when one member is honored, all the members rejoice with it.

27.text: Now you are the body of Christ, and members individually.

28.text: God has set some in the assembly: first apostles, second prophets, third teachers, then miracle workers, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, and various kinds of languages.

29.text: Are all apostles? Are all prophets? Are all teachers? Are all miracle workers?

30.text: Do all have gifts of healings? Do all speak with various languages? Do all interpret?

31.text: But earnestly desire the best gifts. Moreover, I show a most excellent way to you.
